I'm happy to help! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have access to your location, so I can't provide specific recommendations for jewelry stores in your area. But I can give you some general advice on how to find a reputable appraiser.

1. Ask for referrals: Ask friends, family, or colleagues who have had similar experiences for recommendations.
2. Check online directories: Look up professional organizations like the National Association of Jewelry Appraisers (NAJA) or the American Gem Society (AGS) for a list of certified appraisers in your area.
3. Check credentials: Make sure the appraiser has the necessary qualifications, certifications, and experience in evaluating diamonds and jewelry.
4. Research local jewelry stores: Look up local jewelers in your area and read online reviews to find one with a good reputation.

Regarding your lost necklace, I'm so sorry to hear that! Losing a favorite piece of jewelry can be frustrating and upsetting. If you haven't already, you might want to:

1. Contact your friend: Reach out to your friend and let them know you lost the necklace at their place. They might have found it or know someone who has.
2. Retrace your steps: Try to remember the last time you wore the necklace and retrace your steps from that day. You might remember where you took it off or left it.
3. Check with the party venue: If the party was at a public venue, you can contact them to see if anyone has turned in the necklace.

I hope you're able to find a reputable appraiser for your mom's diamond ring and that you're reunited with your lost necklace soon!
